lessons.title: Introduction to Binary Operations
lessons.description: Learn the concept of binary operations and their basic properties. Understand the difference between unary and binary operations.

lessons.title: Evaluating Simple Binary Operations
lessons.description: Practice evaluating basic binary operations like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division using given values.

lessons.title: Understanding Order of Operations
lessons.description: Learn the rules of order of operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS) and apply them to evaluate complex expressions involving multiple binary operations.

lessons.title: Evaluating Expressions with Parentheses
lessons.description: Practice evaluating expressions with parentheses using the order of operations. Understand how parentheses affect the order of evaluation.

lessons.title: Evaluating Expressions with Unknown Variables
lessons.description: Learn how to evaluate expressions with unknown variables by substituting given values. Understand the importance of variable substitution in solving equations.

lessons.title: Evaluating Complex Binary Operations
lessons.description: Practice evaluating expressions with more complex binary operations like exponentiation, modulo, and bitwise operations. Understand the properties and applications of these operations.

lessons.title: Introduction to Inequalities
lessons.description: Understanding the concept of inequalities, their symbols, and their representation on a number line. Learn basic properties of inequalities.

lessons.title: Solving Linear Inequalities
lessons.description: Solving inequalities involving one variable by applying algebraic operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division) while maintaining the inequality.

lessons.title: Solving Compound Inequalities
lessons.description: Solving inequalities involving multiple inequalities connected by 'and' or 'or'. Learn to represent their solution sets on a number line.

lessons.title: Solving Absolute Value Inequalities
lessons.description: Understanding and solving inequalities involving absolute values by considering different cases and applying the properties of absolute values.

lessons.title: Applications of Inequalities
lessons.description: Solving real-world problems involving inequalities, such as optimization problems, distance-rate-time problems, and inequalities in geometry.

lessons.title: Introduction to Simultaneous Equations
lessons.description: Understanding what simultaneous equations are, their purpose, and the different types (linear, non-linear).

lessons.title: Solving Simultaneous Equations by Substitution
lessons.description: Learn the method of substitution for solving two equations with two unknowns.

lessons.title: Solving Simultaneous Equations by Elimination
lessons.description: Master the method of elimination to solve systems of equations by eliminating one variable.

lessons.title: Applications of Simultaneous Equations
lessons.description: Explore real-world problems that can be solved using simultaneous equations, such as age, mixture, and distance problems.

lessons.title: Word Problems with Simultaneous Equations
lessons.description: Practice translating word problems into systems of equations and solving them.

lessons.title: Graphical Solutions to Simultaneous Equations
lessons.description: Visualizing the solutions to simultaneous equations by graphing the lines they represent.

lessons.title: Solving Systems with Three or More Variables
lessons.description: Extend the methods learned to solve systems with more than two variables.

lessons.title: Special Cases and Inconsistencies
lessons.description: Identifying situations where systems have no solutions, infinite solutions, or unique solutions.

lessons.title: Review and Practice
lessons.description: Solve a variety of problems covering all concepts learned, including word problems and application scenarios.

lessons.title: Introduction to Sequence Analysis
lessons.description: Explore the fundamental concepts of sequence analysis, including identifying patterns, trends, and relationships within data.

lessons.title: Types of Sequences
lessons.description: Learn about different types of sequences, such as arithmetic, geometric, and Fibonacci sequences, and their defining characteristics.

lessons.title: Basic Operations on Sequences
lessons.description: Understand how to perform operations like finding the nth term, calculating sums, and determining limits of sequences.

lessons.title: Analyzing Sequence Behavior
lessons.description: Develop skills in analyzing the behavior of sequences, including convergence, divergence, and periodicity.

lessons.title: Applications of Sequence Analysis
lessons.description: Explore real-world applications of sequence analysis in various fields, such as finance, biology, and computer science.

lessons.title: Introduction to Exponentiation
lessons.description: Understanding the concept of exponents and powers, including base, exponent, and their relationship. Learn about the properties of exponents, such as the product rule, quotient rule, and power of a power rule.

lessons.title: Integer Properties with Exponents
lessons.description: Explore the properties of exponents specifically applied to integers, including negative exponents, zero exponents, and fractional exponents. Learn about the impact of even and odd exponents on integer results.

lessons.title: Solving Equations with Exponents
lessons.description: Practice solving equations involving integer exponents, including simplifying expressions and isolating variables. Learn about solving inequalities with exponents and understanding the behavior of exponential functions.

lessons.title: Word Problems with Exponents
lessons.description: Apply the concepts of exponents to solve real-world problems involving growth, decay, and other scenarios. Learn how to translate word problems into mathematical expressions involving exponents.

lessons.title: Advanced Exponent Properties
lessons.description: Dive deeper into advanced properties of exponents, including the binomial theorem, logarithmic transformations, and understanding the relationships between exponents and logarithms.

lessons.title: Introduction to Quadratic Equations
lessons.description: Learn about the standard form of quadratic equations, identifying coefficients and constants. Explore different methods of solving quadratic equations, including factoring, completing the square, and the quadratic formula.

lessons.title: Finding Roots of Quadratic Equations
lessons.description: Understand the concept of roots (solutions) of quadratic equations and their relationship to the graph of the equation. Explore the discriminant and its role in determining the nature of roots (real, imaginary, or equal).

lessons.title: Solving Quadratic Equations by Factoring
lessons.description: Master the techniques of factoring quadratic expressions to find the roots of the equation. Practice factoring various types of quadratics, including simple, complex, and special cases.

lessons.title: Solving Quadratic Equations by Completing the Square
lessons.description: Learn the method of completing the square to solve quadratic equations. Practice converting quadratic equations to vertex form and solving for roots.

lessons.title: Solving Quadratic Equations using the Quadratic Formula
lessons.description: Understand and apply the quadratic formula to find the roots of any quadratic equation. Practice solving complex equations with various coefficients and constants.

lessons.title: Applications of Quadratic Equations
lessons.description: Explore real-world applications of quadratic equations in various fields, such as physics, engineering, and finance. Solve word problems involving quadratic relationships.

lessons.title: Graphing Quadratic Functions
lessons.description: Learn about the shape of the graph of a quadratic function (parabola). Relate the roots of the equation to the x-intercepts of the graph and the vertex to the maximum or minimum point.

lessons.title: System of Equations with Quadratic Equations
lessons.description: Explore how to solve systems of equations that involve one or more quadratic equations. Practice using various methods, such as substitution and elimination.

lessons.title: Review and Practice Problems
lessons.description: Review key concepts and practice solving a variety of quadratic equation problems, including word problems and application-based scenarios.

lessons.title: Mock Exams and Strategy Review
lessons.description: Take mock exams designed to simulate the format and difficulty level of actual exams. Review strategies for effectively solving quadratic equations under time constraints.

lessons.title: Introduction to Quadratic Equations (Roots Sum and Product)
lessons.description: Understanding the relationship between the roots of a quadratic equation and its coefficients. Learn the formulas for sum and product of roots.

lessons.title: Deriving the Sum and Product of Roots Formulas
lessons.description: Explore the derivation of the formulas for sum and product of roots using the quadratic formula and factorization.

lessons.title: Applying Sum and Product of Roots in Problem Solving
lessons.description: Solving problems involving finding the sum and product of roots, given a quadratic equation. Learn to form quadratic equations given sum and product of roots.

lessons.title: Advanced Problems with Roots and Coefficients
lessons.description: Solving more complex problems that involve relationships between the roots, coefficients, and other quadratic equations.

lessons.title: Review and Practice with Roots and Coefficients
lessons.description: Practice with a variety of problems, including those involving word problems and real-world applications of the sum and product of roots.

lessons.title: Introduction to Quadratic Equations (Roots Difference)
lessons.description: Understanding the concept of roots of a quadratic equation and how the difference between them is related to the coefficients of the equation.

lessons.title: Relationship between Roots and Coefficients
lessons.description: Exploring the relationship between the sum and product of roots and the coefficients of the quadratic equation. Deriving the formulas for sum and product of roots.

lessons.title: Finding the Difference of Roots
lessons.description: Using the relationship between roots and coefficients to calculate the difference between the roots of a given quadratic equation.

lessons.title: Word Problems involving Roots Difference
lessons.description: Applying the concepts of roots difference to solve real-world problems involving quadratic equations.

lessons.title: Advanced Techniques for Roots Difference
lessons.description: Exploring advanced techniques for calculating the difference of roots, including using Vieta's formulas and factorization.

lessons.title: Introduction to Right-Angled Triangles
lessons.description: Understand the definition of a right-angled triangle, its key properties, and the Pythagorean Theorem.

lessons.title: Sides and Angles of a Right Triangle
lessons.description: Learn about the hypotenuse, legs, and angles of a right triangle. Practice identifying them in different diagrams.

lessons.title: Pythagorean Theorem Applications
lessons.description: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to calculate unknown side lengths in right triangles. Solve problems involving real-world scenarios.

lessons.title: Trigonometric Ratios
lessons.description: Introduce the concepts of sine, cosine, and tangent. Learn how to use these ratios to calculate angles and side lengths in right triangles.

lessons.title: Solving Right Triangle Problems
lessons.description: Apply trigonometric ratios and the Pythagorean Theorem to solve various problems involving right triangles.

lessons.title: Special Right Triangles
lessons.description: Explore special right triangles such as 30-60-90 and 45-45-90 triangles. Learn their specific ratios and applications.

lessons.title: Introduction to Simultaneous Equations
lessons.description: Understanding the concept of simultaneous equations, their representation, and the goal of finding a solution that satisfies all equations.

lessons.title: Solving Simultaneous Equations by Substitution
lessons.description: Learn the substitution method, where you solve for one variable in terms of another and substitute it into the other equation.

lessons.title: Solving Simultaneous Equations by Elimination
lessons.description: Master the elimination method, where you manipulate equations to eliminate one variable and solve for the other.

lessons.title: Applications of Simultaneous Equations
lessons.description: Explore real-world scenarios where simultaneous equations are used to model and solve problems.

lessons.title: Solving Systems with Three Variables
lessons.description: Extend the methods to solve systems of three or more equations, requiring more systematic elimination techniques.

lessons.title: Graphing Systems of Equations
lessons.description: Visualize the solutions of simultaneous equations by plotting their graphs and finding the point of intersection.

lessons.title: Identifying Inconsistent and Dependent Systems
lessons.description: Learn to recognize when a system has no solution (inconsistent) or infinitely many solutions (dependent).

lessons.title: Practice Solving Simultaneous Equations
lessons.description: Work through various practice problems involving different methods and types of systems.

lessons.title: Word Problems with Simultaneous Equations
lessons.description: Apply the skills to solve word problems that can be modeled using systems of equations.

lessons.title: Review and Common Mistakes
lessons.description: Recap key concepts and common pitfalls in solving simultaneous equations.

lessons.title: Mock Test on Simultaneous Equations
lessons.description: Practice with a mock test to assess your understanding and identify areas for improvement.

lessons.title: Introduction to Permutations
lessons.description: Learn about permutations as arrangements of objects where order matters. Explore the factorial notation and its use in calculating permutations.

lessons.title: Permutations with Restrictions
lessons.description: Understand how to handle permutations when certain objects are fixed or must be placed in specific positions. Explore examples related to race outcomes where finishing positions matter.

lessons.title: Permutations with Repetition
lessons.description: Learn about permutations where objects can be repeated. Apply this concept to scenarios like race outcomes where ties are possible.

lessons.title: Solving Permutations Problems
lessons.description: Practice solving various permutations problems related to race outcomes. Develop strategies to identify and apply the appropriate permutation formula.

lessons.title: Advanced Permutations with Race Outcomes
lessons.description: Explore complex race outcome scenarios involving multiple races, different conditions (e.g., handicaps), and combinations of finishing positions.

lessons.title: Introduction to Algebraic Simplification
lessons.description: Understanding the basics of algebraic expressions, combining like terms, and using the order of operations.

lessons.title: Simplifying Expressions with Variables
lessons.description: Combining like terms with variables, distributing coefficients, and applying the distributive property.

lessons.title: Simplifying Expressions with Exponents
lessons.description: Applying exponent rules, simplifying expressions with exponents, and handling negative exponents.

lessons.title: Simplifying Rational Expressions
lessons.description: Simplifying fractions with variables, finding common factors, and reducing expressions to their simplest forms.

lessons.title: Advanced Simplification Techniques
lessons.description: Using factoring techniques, completing the square, and solving equations by simplifying expressions.

lessons.title: Introduction to Algebraic Expressions
lessons.description: Understanding the building blocks of algebraic expressions, including variables, constants, and operations.

lessons.title: Comparing Expressions with Like Terms
lessons.description: Identifying expressions with the same variables and exponents, and comparing their coefficients.

lessons.title: Comparing Expressions with Different Terms
lessons.description: Analyzing expressions with different variables and exponents, and using substitution to evaluate their values.

lessons.title: Simplifying Expressions Before Comparison
lessons.description: Combining like terms and applying distributive property to simplify expressions before comparison.

lessons.title: Comparing Expressions with Inequalities
lessons.description: Understanding the concepts of greater than, less than, and equal to when comparing algebraic expressions.

lessons.title: Introduction to Inequality Analysis
lessons.description: Understanding the concept of inequality, its various types, and the importance of analyzing it using data. Key concepts like income inequality, wealth inequality, opportunity inequality, and social mobility will be introduced.

lessons.title: Measuring Inequality
lessons.description: Learn different measures of inequality like the Gini coefficient, Lorenz curve, and Palma ratio. Analyze their strengths and weaknesses, and understand how they are used to quantify inequality.

lessons.title: Causes of Inequality
lessons.description: Explore the factors contributing to income and wealth inequality, including economic policies, globalization, technological advancements, discrimination, and social factors.

lessons.title: Consequences of Inequality
lessons.description: Investigate the social, economic, and political consequences of inequality, such as poverty, social unrest, reduced productivity, and hampered economic growth.

lessons.title: Addressing Inequality
lessons.description: Examine various strategies and policies aimed at reducing inequality, including progressive taxation, social welfare programs, education and job training, and promoting fair labor practices.

lessons.title: Interpreting Inequality Data
lessons.description: Develop critical thinking skills to analyze and interpret real-world data on inequality. Learn to identify trends, patterns, and potential biases in data representation.

lessons.title: Analyzing Inequality Across Different Groups
lessons.description: Compare and contrast inequality patterns across different demographic groups, such as gender, race, ethnicity, and socioeconomic status. Explore the factors driving these variations.

lessons.title: Introduction to Multiples
lessons.description: Understanding the concept of multiples, identifying multiples of a given number, and recognizing the relationship between multiples and factors.

lessons.title: Divisibility Rules
lessons.description: Learning and applying divisibility rules for common numbers like 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 9, and 10.

lessons.title: Finding Multiples and Factors
lessons.description: Practicing finding multiples and factors of given numbers using various methods, including prime factorization.

lessons.title: Least Common Multiple (LCM)
lessons.description: Exploring the concept of LCM and its application in solving problems involving multiples.

lessons.title: Greatest Common Factor (GCD)
lessons.description: Understanding the concept of GCD and its relationship with LCM. Solving problems involving GCD and LCM.

lessons.title: Multiples and Word Problems
lessons.description: Applying knowledge of multiples and factors to solve real-world problems involving quantities, proportions, and divisibility.
